data.title: Motorcycle Parking in Malaysia
meta_keywords: Lowyat.NET Malaysia Largest Online Forum Community Kopitiam
data.meta_description: Hello bikers wherever you are in Malaysia.Please share motorcycle parking facilities information in buildings, shopping complexes, public places etcgive comments, price of tickets, entry points etc. TQ   Msia have a fair amount of motorcyclist, the government wants to have less car going into the city center but i find that in most buildings/public places, motorcycle parking is still lacking, difficult to locate, not enough parking space, parking location is too far away etc. We will compile a l...
data.text:
New Member

Junior Member

30 posts

Joined: Apr 2013

Hello bikers wherever you are in Malaysia.

Please share motorcycle parking facilities information in buildings, shopping complexes, public places etc

give comments, price of tickets, entry points etc. TQ

Msia have a fair amount of motorcyclist, the government wants to have less car going into the city center

but i find that in most buildings/public places, motorcycle parking is still lacking, difficult to locate, not enough parking

space, parking location is too far away etc.

We will compile a list of places with the parking charges, and some direction or guidance.

New Member

Junior Member

30 posts

Joined: Apr 2013

Mid Valley Megamall -

one of the most successful mall in KL, have parked my bike there since day one, until today, the bike parking is still like @^%$#&*(*& . The mall never appreciate motorcyclist as customers..

Great Eastern Building - Jln Ampang.

Paid the parking fee only to find that it is full to the brim.

Price - forgotten.

Lowyat Plaza

One of the FOC parking for motor in BB area.

Go down one level, parking space is still ok.

Regular

Senior Member

1,056 posts

Joined: Jul 2005

Some places have very good bike parking facilities, like AEON Rawang.

Others, like MidValley Megamall, have shit parking for bikes - they hide it in some dingy basement dungeon somewhere.

The bad attitude towards bike parking among building mgmt may be in response to the bad attitude among bikers. Everybody knows most kapcai riders don't give a flying f**k about traffic laws, much less parking rules so they dump their bikes anywhere they damn please.

If the kapcai ppl themselves don't care, why should the building mgmt care? So it becomes a vicious circle.

The other thing I want to bring up is the fact that... due to god knows what reason, people who design bike facilities (jalan motor, parking etc) think we're all still riding Honda C50s.

New Member

Junior Member

30 posts

Joined: Apr 2013

QUOTE(ZZR-Pilot @ Jul 25 2017, 11:22 AM)

If the kapcai ppl themselves don't care, why should the building mgmt care? So it becomes a vicious circle.

If property owners, developers, gov, provide enough space for kapchais to park, the riders will used it,

i have been to taiwan several times, they have tons of scooters everywhere, they design bike parking space

right there on the sidewalk without blocking pedestrians walkways.

Here in msia, even the wheelchair user oso susah wana move on sidewalks.. lagi mau kasi lu bike park...

Look at all my stars!!

Senior Member

6,022 posts

Joined: Feb 2014

QUOTE(basilisk @ Jul 25 2017, 11:22 AM)

1U shopping center?

havent park there for a long time, is it still here the entry?

can't rmber last time need to pay ornot...

Yes, same entry.

No need to pay and got 2 guards at different locations to jaga your bikes.

Getting Started

Junior Member

227 posts

Joined: Jun 2007

Midvalley Ok, just my bike can't really fit in when tried to go in and out the paybooth... but for small capacity bike should not be an issue.

Update.. If you want to go KL Sentral, you can actually parked inside Hilton premier parking, if you can squeeze your bike between the parking portal, then there's a bike parking on your left, in front of Hilton security office. Just park ur bike there, then filled up the "guest" book ledger by the wall (slightly inwards) pretend you go to either le meridien or hilton, then you can park all day there.

Protected from the rain, and observed by the security of Hilton hehehe....

This post has been edited by ajaibman: Aug 19 2017, 07:13 PM

Look at all my stars!!

Moderator

4,765 posts

Joined: Jan 2003

From: Kuala Lumpur

QUOTE(basilisk @ Dec 5 2017, 12:04 PM)

Menara Yayasan Tun Razak - Jalan Bukit Bintang

Underground motorcycle parking - per entry RM 1? 50 cent? forgotten

Many kapchais just park at the roadside in front of the building.

Solaris Dutamas - Publika Shopping Gallery

One might think that Publika has covered parking for motocycle - wrong.

All motorbikes, shoppers, patrons, office staff are required to park at an open parking strip

at the far end behind Block D. FOC.

There is a season motobike parking below Block D.

For Publika, do you know the entrance from the other side? From the old SapuraKencana building. Go in, the road splits to 2 (turn left to stay in the same level, go right to go down to B7). Keep left past the lobby area. Its a covered bike park, for free. You enter the building lobby then its connected to publika.

New Member

Junior Member

30 posts

Joined: Apr 2013

QUOTE(echobrainproject @ Dec 12 2017, 11:50 AM)

For Publika, do you know the entrance from the other side? From the old SapuraKencana building. Go in, the road splits to 2 (turn left to stay in the same level, go right to go down to B7). Keep left past the lobby area. Its a covered bike park, for free. You enter the building lobby then its connected to publika.

thx for sharing. when is the last time u've parked there @ kencana?

i went there last month go mapkl. i ride pass the lobby, cant see any entry for parking except for this exit.

then when i was in the kencana building, i walk to the lobby lift. the lift cant go down to the parking. maybe i din find the right lift. should hv ask the guard there.

this is the b7 u mentioned?

This post has been edited by basilisk: Dec 12 2017, 02:07 PM

IG - riezforester

Senior Member

5,947 posts

Joined: Oct 2004

From: Malaysia... Duh!

QUOTE(basilisk @ Dec 12 2017, 02:12 PM)

thx for sharing..

secret means bike oso can secret hilang..

tht parking maybe is used by ktm staff, but ppl oso park there.

first mbike is not suppose to enter the laluan cos is designated bicycle lane liao.

2nd, wana sopping @ mv nid to walk dem far leh.. carry all d barang...

First: No, that couldnt possibly be a designated bike lane as they built motorcycle parking, complete with sign. And they built a second motorcycle area there this year. And no its not just for KTM Staff. They can spend money to build sign that says its a motorcycle parking but not enough money to say its for staff? Are you high?

And the parking is also accessible from the other end. I have no idea why they block it from Federal side.

Second: If you ride motor, most likely the amount you're carrying is minimal. And for god sake jalan from Midvalley to the station also far? No wonder Malaysia is having the highest obese rate in SEA.

New Member

Junior Member

30 posts

Joined: Apr 2013

QUOTE(emino @ Dec 12 2017, 02:18 PM)

First: No, that couldnt possibly be a designated bike lane as they built motorcycle parking, complete with sign. And they built a second motorcycle area there this year. And no its not just for KTM Staff. They can spend money to build sign that says its a motorcycle parking but not enough money to say its for staff? Are you high?

And the parking is also accessible from the other end. I have no idea why they block it from Federal side.

Second: If you ride motor, most likely the amount you're carrying is minimal. And for god sake jalan from Midvalley to the station also far? No wonder Malaysia is having the highest obese rate in SEA.

the motorbike lane existed for ages before dbkl designate the motorbike lane to be bicycle lane frm the bike roundabout , they even put the no entry sign for motorbike in the first place and built barriers. tht was the beginning, now im not sure, cos as usual there is lack of enforcement. i will try find pics of it frm cyclist like ahpek biker etc.

yes, most msian r damn lazy to walk. tht is a fact.

and the distance from the parking to mv compared to mv underground mbike park to mv is far. tht is also a fact.

and last. dont assume mbike riders carry minimal things.

some go grocery shopping by bikes etc.

Look at all my stars!!

the second picture. go in, turn left inside and soon you will find a motorcycle parking area (even before the parking ticket barriers).

It is the same level as the lobby. Dont need to take lift, etc

QUOTE(basilisk @ Dec 12 2017, 02:42 PM)

the motorbike lane existed for ages before dbkl designate the motorbike lane to be bicycle lane frm the bike roundabout , they even put the no entry sign for motorbike in the first place and built barriers. tht was the beginning, now im not sure, cos as usual there is lack of enforcement. i will try find pics of it frm cyclist like ahpek biker etc.

some go grocery shopping by bikes etc.

They constructed the barrier yes. But its funny soon after they develop dedicated parking spot for motor inside. And not so long after that they develop a SECOND parking spot for motor inside as well.

For me that's not a far walk lah. About the same as walking to the paid parking if you ask me, as you simply exit the way people exit to komuter.

And as a biker of more than 15 years I am aware people do grocery shopping using bikes. But usually they do so at places that's more convenient other than MidValley lah.

30 posts

Joined: Apr 2013

QUOTE(Mikahl @ Dec 13 2017, 01:11 AM)

This bike parking section can be pretty packed if it's the one just after the green wall (plants) entrance at G1 just before the car ticket boom gate. I've even seen bikes double park there to the max on occasions, and definitely not for superbikes, way too tight.

yes i agree.

as this is the only "secret" ( means no signage, guard wont tell you ) FOC covered bike parking @ solaris dutamas,

most of the regular workers there will park n double park there.

On workdays it will be full to the brim before working hours starts? and ppl will double park there.

as they only need to exit after working hours, or later.

Not recommended for visitors, as risk kena blocked by bikes, difficult to exit cos very pack.

Getting Started

Junior Member

157 posts

Joined: Jan 2013

QUOTE(basilisk @ Jul 25 2017, 11:14 AM)

Mid Valley Megamall -

one of the most successful mall in KL, have parked my bike there since day one, until today, the bike parking is still like @^%$#&*(*& . The mall never appreciate motorcyclist as customers..

Agree. MV thinks motorcyclist are nobody. I took 3 rounds to be able to find the entrance to the Moto parking. Riding into the Moto parking area is a challenge, the path is full of puddle of water....garbage water ? Then the stair way into the shops is so dirty.

Lucky that they have designated area for big bikes... Else I wouldn't able to park my bike inside as my bike have longer wheelbase than usual bikes.

IG - riezforester

Senior Member

5,947 posts

Joined: Oct 2004

From: Malaysia... Duh!

QUOTE(skyblu3 @ Jan 7 2018, 11:51 AM)

I can afford to pay for it.

Yeah, that's the very definitions of a sucker if you ask me.

Everyone can afford motorcycle parking. But whether its worth the amount, its another story.

Especially if there many other places out there that provides better, quality parking at free of charge, or at least worth the amount.

By paying for something you yourself consider shitty and filled with garbage water, you're actually condoning the practice.

New Member

Junior Member

30 posts

Joined: Apr 2013

This is the previously mentioned Motorcycle Parking next to KTM Commuter Mid Valley Station.

You can park here and walk to mid valley. Did not notice any lighting, so it could be dark at night.

Kinda secluded and low traffic.

Initially, DBKL starts the Bicycle lane at this point.

No entry sign for motorcycle and barriers are erected.

Then DBKL realised that motorbike need to exit into Jalan Syed Putra as well,

so they push back the starting point. And some barriers are removed.

Now Bicycle lane starts here.

Motorbike exits here, near volvo.

Motorcycle parking space under the fly over.

Yes, If I am not mistaken park next to the building is 50 cent.

But better to park indoor, at the Gurney underground carpark. The entrance is facing the sea, same with the car entrance. Its also 50cent as well.

Thx for the info!

Not frm PG, so duno gurney got underground parking as well...

Do you know y ppl pay the RM1.2 parking beside instead of going under for 50 sen??

Not frm PG, so duno gurney got underground parking as well...

Do you know y ppl pay the RM1.2 parking beside instead of going under for 50 sen??

There is a small mamak stall at the entrance of Rm1.2 parking.. perhaps they can have a cup of teh tarik 1st?

Probably some of the biker prefer to store their helmet there, or they might think its safer as there are always someone watching over their bike & helmets?

The underground carpark seldom have security pass by, so chances of missing your helmet should be high. Mostly just kapcai with affordable helmet park over there.

QUOTE(bonez_xy @ Jan 9 2018, 11:37 PM)

Last week i didnt find any entrance for motorcyle parking at nu sentral and in the end i just park my bike near the taxi stand at kl sentral air terminal where theres plenty of bike park there.

Manage to drop by and check it out.

Didnt go down to look at the parking, next time.

Nu Sentral Motorcycle parking. Underground basement parking.

Entrance is @ Jalan Tun Sambanthan, no signage at all.

Just After Aloft, there is a outlet with NO ENTRY sign. It is an exit for cars parked @ basement of Nu Sentral.

Turn left and go in, the bike parking is on the RIGHT side.

Lookout for cars exiting.

PC and MotorBicycle Enthusiast

Hello, anyone knows about the IOI citymall putrajaya >500cc bike parking just in front of the shopping mall entrence?

Signboard says motorcycle parking is available there, but the only 2 boomgate/entrence is just for cars - there is no smaller boomgate for >500cc bikes? Or do i have to act like a car/pay same price like a car to park the premium parking?

Getting Started

Junior Member

111 posts

Joined: Apr 2009

I went to UTC Pudu last friday and was shocked when the autopay machine says rm5 as I put my ticket in. Luckily, I had experience working with parking equipment and systems so I went to check at manual pay counter. Managed to dispute the price because its written on the board next to the counter that its only rm2 per entry for bikes.

Surprisingly the parking management actually knew this but failed to put up any notice or inform the customers in any way.

So if you guys went there please check if the parking fees adds up to their written price.

Getting Started

Junior Member

227 posts

Joined: Jun 2007

just want to share with you (again) in case I forgot, for those who want to park near KLCC area, you can use the bike parking at tower3 basement parking.. the entrance from Jalan P. Ramlee .. (Where all the night club are) and there is a ramp going down to the basement just at the junction of Menara TA and if turning right you headed towards Aston/Hilton hotel.

You can park next to BMW or Ducati parked there, in case worried about your brake caliper safety..

Fee is 2 Rm whole day.. (don't loose your ticket) and paid at the machine near the KLCC LG floor mall.. (near the Nyonya Colors)

Go towards the back of the building (through their lobby) and there's a sign of Car Park entry.. go in there.. just right after the entrance (before the Car Park Barrier gate) .. to the left is big bike parking and to the right is small bike parking..

QUOTE(equest_sales @ Oct 4 2018, 08:59 AM)

Any one Know where is the motorbike parking in Menara UOA Bangsar. Had ask the guard, guard also not sure. really.....

Simply park road side, Some time will get DBKL fine. Sometime really hard to find motorbike parking in KL area and DBKL fine is no cheap for motorbike.

Menara UOA dont hv bike parking? i think so.. maybe u can park at dataran maybank and walk over, better than risking DBKL saman...

Effective way to reduce traffic is to ride a motorbike..

sadly this country.. doesn't favour or encourage motorcyclist..

Here's a tip. Always park your bike where there are plenty of foot traffic. The presence of people tend to drive the thieves away.

The downside to this especially if you're riding a big bike, people tend to take it unto themselves to pose and mount your bike for pics as well for shits and giggles.

QUOTE(jojojo897 @ Jan 30 2019, 07:47 PM)

Anyone know where to park motor at scott garden

scott garden is like dead now aft tesco moved out.

ive parked there since early tesco days, n now wit decathlon + mr diy moved back there.

so i only know tht level where decaton + mrdiy is. maybe other level also can park bike.

frm okr heading to mid valley, scott gar on ur left jz aft the npe overhead, u turn left, go up the slope. u will see entrance for car on ur right, pass that, n right aft tht u will see a smaller entrance with no barrier, ur bike can go in there.

once inside go straight one level down, turn left go straight, u will see entrance on ur left, tht is the level where tesco used to be, behind the rows of cars, u can park ur bike there.

Hi guys.

Is there any parking at Ikea or e@curve? I saw earlier post mentioned that ikano have bike parking but not sure about the other malls nearby. Plan to ride there everyday. LDP jam giler.

the curve yes, underground, i think i hv posted earlier.

QUOTE(kahtsin @ Aug 22 2019, 04:53 PM)

I assume south parking is this one right?? Holy shit, 8am full!? worse than cars. Then north punya entrance mana??

yeah... when u enter there, the first one u see is the south one...

depends on luck... ive arrived there at 830am before and theres enough space... but another day at same time can have a long que to go in. if ur on a kapchai, not much of a problem as u can move other kapchais around to make space to park ur bike. if ur on a big bike which doesnt have double stand, then might be tough... coz even FZ (those with double stand) will park at the big bike parking area.

north parking is the same entrance as the google pic u posted.. but instead of going into the first parking u see... just keep going and pass by the south parking... just keep following the path there and u will reach it.

On my way

I see, noted with many thanks! I saw some videos on YT, sometimes can see big bike parked right at the parking entrance and was wondering just how safe is it to do that. Also, do the parking directly connects to the mall or you need to walk out?

QUOTE(kahtsin @ Aug 23 2019, 09:38 PM)

I guess a zx-6r or ninja 400 would be very manageable la. haha okay thanks a lot man!!!

This talking about the MV bike parking when you go up the ladder end up in front of Maybank/Pondok Police right?

Parked there before on the Big Bike section with my RT.. its almost the width of Kancil, a bit struggle when you pay parking due to small entrance and immediate turning into the big bike section but manageable if you know how...

What you need to do since you going to park there daily, increase the security of ur bike by upgrading your brake/master caliper with security bolt and nuts.. since its the easiest to steal instead the whole bike..

QUOTE(basilisk @ Aug 26 2019, 10:27 PM)

prized ones of cos brembo nissin,.. but got case smaller bikes oso kena.. so depen on their mood...

Don't forget BYBRE. The caliper theft cases among KTM, Pulsar and Dominar owners is crazy.

However, I figure there has to be some factors considered by the thieves. I don't think even a person with addiction to theft will just go stealing ANY Nissin caliper because they're very common on many bikes, and there's no thrill in that. The target must be worth something, like 4-piston radial-mounted Nissin calipers, which are uncommon and high-end.

That's why I mentioned the bikes in my previous post, because those bikes don't have calipers with obvious branding and/or are high performance. If they're not desirable by this crowd, they should be relatively safe to park nearly anywhere, like the Honda PCX.

QUOTE(basilisk @ Aug 27 2019, 01:00 AM)

i just checked on fb. caliper frm mt07 versys650 er6f/n vulcanS all got ppl steal.. those arent radial mounted ..

anything tats bigger than kapchai... be careful...

Radial mounted was an example, not literally all that they would target. MT07, Versys, ER6F/N all have dual front discs, which many of these crowd like to mod onto their kapchais. The Vulcan S is the only outlier there because it has a relatively unimpressive brake system. Generally there is always a reason.

On the other hand, are there many cases for R25, Z250, Ninja 250, etc.?

Also, please don't misunderstand. I'm not trying to say people shouldn't be careful and not take security measures, but that there is still a scale that exists for desirability of these calipers. Otherwise, we wouldn't have such things as 'motor sejuk' and 'motor panas'. Kapchai are also equally vulnerable to theft depending on the model, after all, like the Y15ZR V2 head thefts recently.

QUOTE(ajaibman @ Aug 27 2019, 01:54 AM)

well logically anything bigger than Kapchai has better braking system if their brake caliper applied to a kapchai?

or perhaps I am wrong? off course the Brembo or Nissin is with gold shining is the primary target, but then if they have opportunity and potential victim why not?

Saw few abandoned bikes on the road and it ranges from Jaguh until RGSports - Mostly kapchai, and guess what, many of them have front brake disc and caliper... (saves the drum brake ex5, but they also missing front rim and such..

Because I don't think it's as simple as bigger bikes = better brakes than kapchai = all equally prized. Otherwise the caliper theft cases would be far more widespread. Imagine, all those Chinese and Taiwanese big bikes and maxiscooters would have their unbranded calipers being stolen en-masse too. Instead, we only get cases of specific brands being targeted, other than the abandoned bikes you mentioned which are basically free pickings.

There's performance, but image and trendiness has something to do with it as well. Having something branded like Brembo, Nissin, etc. on your bike gives street cred among peers. Getting a double front disc brake setup on a kapchai is also increased street cred. Radial calipers? Street cred. All of these things factor into why these thefts occur.

Hopefully everyone understands what I'm trying to say here.

The point is, no matter what, better safe than sorry... invest a bit for extra protection wont do no harm.

I don't disagree, as I mentioned in my post above. If you ask me, I think the minimum every big biker should invest in is a good alarm brake disc lock.

QUOTE(kahtsin @ Aug 27 2019, 06:05 PM)

OT a bit, any god-like or good brands to recommend?

Right now Veison and Kovix seem to be popular, but Kovix is more expensive. Xena was one of the biggest last time but they seem to have closed shop.

If to deter caliper theft while parking, get one alarm disc lock for each disc brake along with reminder cables so you don't forget to take them off before you ride.

You can also enhance the security by throwing in one of those RM20 alarms on your bike. Not the type that needs to be connected to the bike battery, but the ones powered by 9V cell or AAA batteries that come with a remote.

Just to share in case anyone is curious. The Linc KL has free motorcycle parking - accessible at the car entrance, there is a lane for bikes that you can ride through without having to go through the barriers.

Pros:

+ Free (as mentioned)

+ Covered

Cons:

- Limited motorcycle bays

- Parking bays hidden behind car bays which makes it hard to get in and out if the car park is full

- Lots of motorcycle parking there so you have to get creative to get your bike parked or muscle your way and move the parked bikes

- The more open motorcycle bays are not covered but can only accomodate 10 bikes 🤦‍♂️

QUOTE(kualaloco79 @ May 18 2022, 11:54 AM)

hi guys, anyone have any idea where does motorcycle parking at Tower H, Empire City located?

Update on this, manage to clear up some time to go and ride around the area. the parking area for bike is at B2 the same as car park. Parking is free and for every tower there it have it's own designated motorcycle parking area.

Cons is that the parking area is damn hot without any ventilation whatsoever. few minutes there and i'm already sweating.

If you coming from DUKE, take the left EXIT 2302 towards lebuhraya LDP and take left turn near BMW, Proton showroom there and continue straight follow the course of the road and you'll see empire city signboard.

after reaching Empire City, go down the right small road EXIT TO LDP and you'll see B2 parking there.
